result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas E. Franz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be collected through probation as in courtesty on case 14cf87.

W/Huber for all purposes
Consecutive to: reconfinement time

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas E. Franz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:02 am - Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Thomas E. Franz in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf59 and 14cf87.  In case 14cf59 - State moves to amend to 961.41 (3g)(b) - Possession of a Controlled Substance an unclassified misdemeanor - Granted.  In Case 14cf87 - State amends to Add Count 3 - 948.06 - Sex with Child Age 16 or Older - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire previously filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of 14cf59 and counst 2 and 3 in case 14cf87 but defers judgment on count 1 in case 14cf87.  Schiek/Richards/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
14cf59 - Jail 30 days W/huber for all purposes CS to reconfinement time - Court Costs - Probation to collect as courtesy in case 14cf87
14cf87 - Counts 2 and 3 - Concurrent
WHS/POP 2 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
To collect Costs in Case 14cf59 as courtesy
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given

11:40 am - Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Thomas E. Franz in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf59 and 14cf87.  Michlig reviews file in case 14cf87 - State files Victim Info from file.  Michlig does not believe proper notice was provided to all victims.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Bail continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

11:02 a.m. Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court, in custody, with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CF87. Schiek speaks close to resolution. Defendant in receipt of Information; reads waiving. Defendant pleads not guilty. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 11:30 am.

9:11 a.m. Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court, in custody, with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig statement; not resolved at this time; additional case pending. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 11:00 am.

03:35 pm - Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court with attorney Steven G Richards, appearing telephonically with leave of the court.  Defendant Thomas E. Franz in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Richards - In receipt of Information, waives reading - enters not guilty plea.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
No contact w/Carrie Steinmetz is lifed, may not discuss case w/Steinmtez.  Defendant may not have contact w/Scott Dumpprope and/or Gerry Fredrick Jr.

03:31 pm - Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court with attorney Steven G Richards.  Defendant Thomas E. Franz in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information.  Richards in receipt of Information, waives reading.  Richards states defendant may request substitution of judge - Court will allow Richards to appear telephonically for arraignment. Richards requests no contact provision with Steinmetz be lifted.  Michlig statement to request.  Court lifts the no contact w/Steinmetz - may not discuss case.  No contact provision with Franz to be lifted as well.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

02:46 pm - Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court, via video,  with attorney Steven G Richards.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Richards requests speed trial.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  Bail continued.  Defendant raises issues of no contact.  Court denies request.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

02:35 pm - Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court, via video,  in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erickson represents - unable to be present at today's hearing.  Bail continued.  Defendant requests speedy trial and requests no contact provision be removed.  Defendant advised to address these concerns with Erickson.  Attorney Finlan address Court - represents Steinmetz and no contact provision.  Court will not grant modification request.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
No contact w/co-defendants Scott Dumpprope, Gerry Fredrick Jr., and/or Carrie Steinmetz

01:36 pm - Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court, via video, in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel/PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
